posts.author: Demos
posts.content:
Concept-wise, #1 and #3 are fine. Weapon choice is personal and we can talk about feat optimization later but they look like they will work well. Both are basically melee juggernauts that are *point*, *click* and *KILL*.

I'm not a fan of #2. Going halfling will inflict an XP penalty starting at level 4 and you're burning points on a stat that starts with a penalty. Now, going Dwarf would be pretty sweet (lose some skill points and a feat but get 40 extra HP). As for Discipline, you can drop some off of UMD and Spellcraft for Discipline. On WoG, there aren't many mobs with Disarm or Called Shot (from what I can remember) and anti-KD equipment is available so it may not be too big a deal anyway.

posts.author: Demos
posts.content:
Your dual-wielder will actually have an AB of 38 when you have both handaxes out since it is -2/-2 penalty with 2 small weapons and the necessary feats. Your primary attack schedule is going to be +38/+33/+28/+23. Unless you're fighting low AC mobs, that 4th attack will often times need a 20 to hit. Clerics aside, if you can grab the 4th attack on a toon (pre-epic bab of 16), it's pretty silly not to.

I wouldn't worry about it on your Bard/RDD/PM. Again, that 4th attack (if you had one) would have been at +25 so there is a good chance it will also miss.

Strength is a modifier for Discipline but it is no substitute for it. I would drop points off of Spellcraft and some from UMD to bump Discipline. It also helps if your weapon is at least the same size as the mobs.
